intro: Dicrastylis glauca, commonly known as the blue star grass, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers in dense clusters. It thrives in wetlands and swampy areas, often forming dense vegetation. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for wetland ecosystems and ecological studies.
